definition: to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: They were traditionally semisedentary, moving seasonally between fixed sites.
sentences.chinese: 他們是傳統的半定居部落，在定居點間季節性遷移。

sentences.english: The size of those blocks and how Jerusalem might be shared has never been determined.
sentences.chinese: 那些定居點的規模以及將如何劃分耶路撒冷仍未決定。

sentences.english: The derro make haste to their new settlement at a forced march.
sentences.chinese: 迪洛矮人向新定居點急行軍。

sentences.english: The Jewish settlements in west bank and Gaza strip is one of those cruxes.
sentences.chinese: 猶太人在西岸和加沙的定居點問題就是其中一大症結。

sentences.english: He said there is no middle solution on the settlement issue.
sentences.chinese: 他說，在定居點的問題上沒有中間道路可走。

sentences.english: It is located on Awaji Island, one of the oldest settlements in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 它位於淡路島，一個在日本最古老的定居點。

sentences.english: We never promised to freeze construction in those areas," he said.
sentences.chinese: 我們從來沒有承諾要在那些地區凍結定居點建設。

sentences.english: Because there is no long-term solid settlements life, that they have learned various skill.
sentences.chinese: 由於無長期固定居點的生活，使他們學會了各種技藝。

sentences.english: The Indians often attacked the settlements of the colonist.
sentences.chinese: 印地安人經常襲擊殖民者的定居點。

sentences.english: This settlement is built over my land," Ghneim said.
sentences.chinese: 這個定居點是在我的地上修建的。

sentences.english: He also made no mention of settlements.
sentences.chinese: 他也沒有提及定居點問題。

sentences.english: One of the most remote settlements of the country.
sentences.chinese: 這是國家中最遙遠的定居點之一。

sentences.english: As its name indicates, it was one of the Moorish settlements, and nearly one of the most northern.
sentences.chinese: 地如其名，它幾乎是最靠北的摩爾人定居點。

sentences.english: Israel is considering a compromise with the United States on the thorny issue of Jewish settlements.
sentences.chinese: 以色列考慮在棘手的猶太人定居點議題上跟美國妥協。

sentences.english: The travelers pushed inland, questing for signs of human settlement.
sentences.chinese: 旅行者向內地推進，探索人類定居點的遺蹟。

sentences.english: The Zerg will start trying to infest the five other civilian settlements.
sentences.chinese: 蟲族將開始試圖再加上另外五個平民的定居點。
